mdcdesign-

I have a question. I installed windows 8 pro and sent for my wmc upgrade key. I upgraded with new key and activation was set. Now... if I formatted and reinstalled your version of windows 8 with media center and entered the key that Microsoft sent me when upgrading my previous install, would it reactivate with that same key used on the same machine? Or is it a one shot deal? Also... after the Jan. deadline, can that key be used if I need to reinstall again on that same machine later down the road?

Just to answer a few of the questions on here :)

1) RTM is the same as Retail, there's no difference in the code whatsoever, the only thing which differs between the WUA (Windows Upgrade Assistant) ISOs is that the installation image is a compressed ESD file, rather than a WIM file, which means you can't slipstream service packs and features such as WMC. This, as someone correctly pointed out, is based on the MSDN ISOs, which are the primary distribution media for Windows 8.

2) If you've already activated your box using your WMC prior to installing this, then essentially that key is tied to your hardware. From what we've been able to ascertain on MyDigitalLife, that key can then be used to activate on that same machine an infinite number of times; so reformatting and reinstalling should work fine, until you change your hardware. If you change your hardware, you can still use the automated phone activation, and will pass with no issues.

For those leaving - Quality... It must be User Fault. This works flawless on Install and Passes as Genuine. Just follow the very simple directions. The OP made it super easy. If you don't know how to properly burn an ISO that is your fault.

For those with upgrade questions. You can upgrade. Win 7 users retain files/programs during upgrade. XP/Vista users will not be able to keep files. All other legacy users must do full install...

However - why upgrade? Only advantage is that it saves work and only if you are migrating from Win 7. A clean install is ALWAYS best. Do the work. Back up all your files and program installs. Wipe that hard drive clean 3x. (I use System Rescue CD - Google it, it will save your sanity on a regular basis as it kicks ***) Install a fresh Windows 8 and enjoy that new computer feeling.
